newsitem.title: POLAND: Karcher to invest PLN 58 mln in Poland '97.
newsitem.headline: Karcher to invest PLN 58 mln in Poland '97.

text.p: Germany's trader Raab Karcher AG, a subsidary of VEBA AG, plans to invest 58 million in Poland next year in expanding its current trade and service net and entering new sectors, the president of Raab Karcher said.

Georg Kulenkampff said the firm, which had been offering on the Polish market building materials and equipment for the energy and fuel sectors, and had invested 30 million zlotys since 1990, wanted to expand into new sectors next year.

"Raab Karcher wants to invest 58 million zlotys in Poland in 1997 in developing the sectors we are already present in, but also in two new sectors - electronics and security," he told a news conference.
Kulenkampff said Raab Karcher was planning a further increase in investments in the next few years.
"There are plans to expand our presence on the Polish market and...to set up new branches which must lead to further investments," he said.
"I can easily imagine our investment budget could double," Kulenkampff added, but did not give details.
He said that the company expected its sales in Poland to rise to 120 million zlotys this year from 70 million in 1995.
